Items.Title: Messages and Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the certificate0 setting forth the maximum amount of debt & reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority & the NYC Health & Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects the Fiscal Year 2001 & the ensuing three fiscal years, & the maximum amount of appropriations & expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250(16) of the New York City Charter.
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Executive Budget Supporting Schedules, Volume I-V, for Fiscal Year 2001, pursuant to Section 250 of the New York City Charter.
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Expense Revenue Contract, for Fiscal Year 2001, pursuant to Section 249 of the New York City Charter.
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Capital Commitment Plan, Executive Budget, Fiscal Year 2001, Volumes I, II and III, pursuant to Section 219(d) of the New York City Charter.
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Executive Capital Budget for Fiscal Year 2001, pursuant to section 249 of the New York City Charter.
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Executive Budget - Geographic Reports for Expense Budget for Fiscal Year 2001.

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Executive Capital Budget Fiscal Year 2001, Capital Project Detail Data, Citywide Volumes 1 and 2 and Volumes for the Five Boroughs, dated April 18, 2000 pursuant to the provisions of Sections 213 (4) and 219 (D) of the New York City Charter.
Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Budget Summary and Message of the Mayor, relative to the Executive Budget, Fiscal Year 2001, pursuant to Section 249 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Budget, Summary & Message of the Mayor

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Proposed City Fiscal Year 2001 Community Development Program, the Proposed CFY'00 Budget, the Proposed Reallocations - the CD XXVI Funds, Proposed CD XXVII Statement of Objectives and Budget, dated April 18, 2000.

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT in relation to authorizing the city of New York to grant easements over portions of parkland known as Riverside Park in the Borough of Manhattan to the National Park Service for the construction and operation of public facilities in connection with the General Grant National Memorial."  S.6692/A.8106A

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to the powers and duties of municipal directors in cities with a population of one million or more regarding enforcement of the payment of inspection and testing fees"  S.3861/A.6408
Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to service returnable to the environmental control board for poster law offenses." S.1182A/A.5372A

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the seizure and forfeiture of vehicles used to transport unstamped or unlawfully stamped packages of cigarettes and the imposition of civil penalties for counterfeit cigarette tax stamps."  S.4153/A.1787-A
Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to contracts for public work."  S.2284/A.4222

By Council Member Robles:
Resolved pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application 990449PPK located at various sites shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title: Commissioner of Deeds

Introduction and Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling on the British government to arrange for the return of the sculptures known as the "Elgin Marbles" from the British Museum to its rightful place in Athens, Greece.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold public hearings on the need for additional funding to be allocated to help individuals who are afflicted with the Hepatitis C virus.

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend article 150 of the New York State Penal Law to make the intentional setting of a fire in a building of public use, such as a school, senior center or place of religious worship, the class B felony of arson in the second degree.
Items.MatterName: Arson, buildings of public use, State Action.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a moratorium on requests to the council related to the development or disposition of greenthumb community gardens.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment and maintenance of greenthumb community gardens.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings on the defects in the Metrocard Vending Machines.

Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the City Council to hold an oversight hearing on the failure of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and its contractors to implement a satellite tracking system.
Items.MatterName: Oversight Hearing, MTA Satellite Tracking System

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notification to community boards and council members of certain temporary closing of streets.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation, to the warehousing of Mitchell-Lama apartments.
A resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to hold a hearing on the policy of each of the City's District Attorneys regarding domestic violence complaints.
Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to conduct hearings on the Police Department's rules regarding press pass distribution to the media.

Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to issue public service messages and post signs clearly explaining the different meanings of the expiration dates under its Metrocard program at Metrocard point of sales locations as well as in any other manner that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority deems appropriate, and also post such information on each Metrocard.

Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to establish a dedicated fund to create new affordable housing using the additional real estate taxes paid by developments that withdraw from the Mitchell-Lama program.

Resolution calling upon the Department of Housing Preservation and Development to include residents of City-Aided Limited Profit Housing Companies as significant participants in the process of revising the rules governing those companies and their properties.
Items.MatterName: City-Aided Limited Profit Housing Co., Rules

Items.Title: Resolution urging the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, the U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of New York and the District Attorneys of all five boroughs to work together to prosecute gun-related crimes by allowing state prosecutors to be cross-designated as federal prosecutors for these purposes.
Resolution in support of the enactment of H.R. 2900, The Clean Smokestacks Act of 1999, which would help reduce the cumulative effect of air emissions from new power plants proposed to be built.
Items.MatterName: Clean Smokestacks Act of 1999, State Action

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the late Dr. Aristedes de Sousa Mendes of Portugal for his humanitarian acts during World War II in conjunction with  a photographic exhibition at the United Nations' Manhattan headquarters entitled "Visas for Life: The Righteous Diplomats."
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: In Memorium, Dr. Aristedes de Sousa Mendes

Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations

Items.Title: Resolution commending United States Attorney General Janet Reno on her decision to rule in favor of Elian Gonzalez returning home to Cuba to live with his father.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.6891-A, and Assembly Member Kaufman, A.9573, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of The Bronx to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from former owner Frank Switay, deceased, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3978, Lot No. 4 on tax map for the borough of The Bronx".

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Schneiderman, Montgomery, Sampson, Stachowski, S.1649, and Assembly Members Dinowitz, Klein, Ramirez, Greene, Kaufman, et al, A.2798, "AN ACT to dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland".

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the seizure and forfeiture of vehicles used to transport unstamped or unlawfully stamped packages of cigarettes and the imposition of civil penalties for counterfeit cigarette tax stamps."  S.4153/A.1787-A

Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT in relation to authorizing the city of New York to grant easements over portions of parkland known as Riverside Park in the Borough of Manhattan to the National Park Service for the construction and operation of public facilities in connection with the General Grant National Memorial." Resolution calling upon the Royal Ulster Constabulary to divulge pertinent security information to the thirteen Belfast City Council members, four Lisburn Borough Council members and other Sinn Fein political figures that were issued death threats from loyalist paramilitaries.
